topic.title: Client Mapping Datapath Segment De-provisioning API Details

section.title: g5_api_deprov()
section.p: The g5_api_deprov() API is used to de-provision client mapping datapath segments. The parameters and associated enumerated types are below.
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter of the API is the channel ID for the Ethernet client port or Interlaken channel ID to be de-provisioned.

The enumerated type g5_deprov_t of the g5_api_deprov() API defines the scope of resources that are cleaned up as part of a de-provisioning operation when a partial or completely configured datapath is torn down. The enumerator G5_DEPROV_SEGMENT_MAPPER de-provisions the mapper component of the Ethernet client port or Interlaken packet channel chnl_id only up to the OCPB. The enumerator G5_DEPROV_PATH_MAPPER de-provisions the chnl_id and any children of the chnl_id including de-provisioning of connected child IDs until the mapper functionality is completely removed. The primary chnl_id associated with these mapper functions will be retained. If there is no mapper in the datapath the behavior of G5_DEPROV_SEGMENT is followed when it is called for a Ethernet port or Interlaken packet chnl_id that includes mapper functionality. In this case the primary chnl_id is maintained and the mapper and anything connected to the mapper is removed.
